alert.note: Alert for DeKalb (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 28 at 8:47PM EDT until August 29 at 4:38AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Snapfinger Creek near Decatur affecting DeKalb County. For the South River Basin...including Atlanta, Atlanta, Atlanta, Decatur, Decatur, Atlanta, Decatur, Lithonia, Atlanta, Lithonia, Lithonia, Conyers, Snapping Shoals, Flippen...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Snapfinger Creek near Decatur. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 12 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding will occur in portions of the woodlands and yards near the creek upstream and downstream from the gage on Redan Road. This will primarily affect locations off South Indian Creek Drive and Rowland Road upstream from the gage. A park near the creek off of Rowland Road will begin to flood. The drain pipes under the bridge at Redan Road will no longer function properly...which will cause drainage water to backup on low portions of the road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:31 PM EDT Monday the stage was 11.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 12.2 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 12 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.3 feet on 10/25/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 445 AM EDT.
